intro: Arisanorchis tairae, commonly known as the Tairae orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has a short rhizome and produces a single, upright stem with several lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow with intricate patterns, and it thrives in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
